articles.title: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Nvidia, Apple, Tesla, GM, Microsoft, CarMax, U.S. Steel, Warner Bros., and More
articles.content: Shares of Nvidia, Apple, and Tesla fall sharply Thursday after each stock soared double-digits Wednesday following President Donald Trump’s move to pause most reciprocal tariffs for 90 days. U.S. Steel, meanwhile, slumps after Trump says he wants the steel maker to remain an American company.

articles.title: Why Apple Stock Is Sinking Today
articles.content: Shares of Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) are heading lower in Thursday's trading.  The stock market skyrocketed yesterday after President Donald Trump announced a 90-day lifting of reciprocal tariffs on all countries except China, but valuations are heading lower today after new information emerged.  While Trump announced yesterday that an import tax rate of 125% would be applied to Chinese goods, it turns out the tariff rate is now 145%.

articles.title: Sector Update: Tech Stocks Plunge Late Afternoon
articles.content: Tech stocks tumbled late Thursday afternoon with the Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK) fallin

articles.title: Apple's Efforts to Prepare for Tariffs
articles.content: Carolina Milanesi, Creative Strategies president and principal analyst, says Apple's reported airlift of iPhones from India to the US ahead of tariffs is unlike anything she has seen in her career. She explains why Apple is unlikely to build iPhones in the US with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Technology."

articles.title: Apple airlifted 600 tons of iPhones to the U.S. to try to beat Trump’s tariffs as customers scramble to secure devices before possible price increases
articles.content: The company produces most of its iPhones in China, which is subject to 145% tariffs.

articles.title: Oil falls, China tensions weigh on Apple, Disney: Market Minute
articles.content: Here are some of the stories Wall Street is watching on Thursday, April 10. The ongoing trade battle between the US and China is weighing on shares of Apple (AAPL), Disney (DIS), and Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). Oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) are also falling on worries that tariffs could weigh on demand. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

articles.title: Mag 7 market cap value surged on tariff pause news
articles.content: The "Magnificent Seven," made up of Nvidia (NVDA), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Tesla (TSLA), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Meta (META), and Apple (AAPL), added over $1.8 trillion to their market capitalizations during the tariff pause–fueled stock rally on Wednesday. In this episode of Stocks in Translation, podcast host Jared Blikre dives deeper into the latest price action for large-cap tech names. Catch more Stocks in Translation here, with new episodes every Tuesday and Thursday. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

articles.title: Apple's Secret iPhone Airlift: How Tim Cook Outsmarted Trump's Tariffs
articles.content: 1.5 million iPhones. 600 tons. Zero delays. Inside Apple's stealth move to save billions--and dominate the India game.
